So Question on something i saw it he forms area. It looks like for the forms, you can choose a font from Google Font't to use for your form. Is there anyway this Font Family setting could instead be added to the website area at all?

I know for a lot of client sites we are always accessing the google font library and if this was something that could be set globally we could then use something `{{company.font.name}} or {{company.font.size}} or {{company.font.weight}}`

I know in the documentation on here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-variables> it mentions `setting from Content Settings > Colors and Fonts.` but i dont think that is a real section anymore

part idea, part bug: when you enter a page or blog post title, and the slug is automatically generated, that generator should strip non-essential punctuation. i’m ending up with things like “<http://mysite.com/report:-a-vs.-b>” in my URLs, which can lead to issues in the wild.
